intro: Frankenia grandifolia, commonly known as the coastal bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, with small, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in dune environments. Frankenia grandifolia is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate periods of drought, making it a resilient species in coastal ecosystems.
